intro: Harpalyce hidalgensis, commonly known as the Hidalgo harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its seed pods contain small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation across its native habitat. Harpalyce hidalgensis plays a minor role in local ecosystems, providing food for certain insect species.
